body:
The mount command doesn't run in the background. So stick an & on the end of the command and it will behave like you are expecting.

I will emphasize this in the docs as it is different to most fuse mounts. However it is hard getting go stuff to run in the background.

I should probably spend some more time trying to figure that out!

I was totally confused when I tried to launch the rclone mount without the '&' at the end.
Please make this more obvious when mounting.

rename.to: Put rclone mount in the background

body: @robdidop I've moved this up to a feature request so I can actually put rclone mount in the background like it is supposed to be!

issue.title: Feature Request: mount.rclone helper

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
It would be really handy if there was a mount.rclone wrapper that can be used in /etc/fstab. It would need to accept all the usual paremeters using slightly different syntax, e.g.

rclone --max-read-ahead 4M --read-only --config /path/to/config mount foo:/bar baz

would need to be expressed to the mount helper as:

mount.rclone -o max-read-ahead=4M,ro,config=/path/to/config foo:/bar baz

And, of course, mount.rclone would have to wait until the fs has completed mounting and then go into the background.

Perhaps this could be done by making rclone check whether the binary name it was invoked as is mount.rclone, and if so, alter it's parameter format expectations?

body:
This looks like a good library

https://github.com/sevlyar/go-daemon

Also need to add `-f` or `--foreground` to not daemonise.
Please test this with the beta release: [v1.39-199-gebfeec9f](https://beta.rclone.org/v1.39-199-gebfeec9f/).
